Stereotype.name: DataTypeMap
Stereotype.notes: This class represents the relationship between ApplicationDataType and its implementing Abstract ImplementationDataType.

Stereotype.name: DataTypeMappingSet
Stereotype.notes: This class represents a list of mappings between ApplicationDataTypes and ImplementationDataTypes. In addition, it can contain mappings between ImplementationDataTypes and ModeDeclarationGroups.

Tag.name: dataTypeMap
Tag.description: This is one particular association between an ApplicationDataType and its AbstractImplementationDataType.

Tag.name: modeRequest
Tag.description: This is one particular association between an ModeDeclarationGroup and its AbstractImplementationDataType.

Stereotype.name: ModeDeclaration
Stereotype.notes: Declaration of one Mode. The name and semantics of a specific mode is not defined in the meta-model.

Stereotype.name: ModeDeclarationGroup
Stereotype.notes: A collection of Mode Declarations. Also, the initial mode is explicitly identified.

Stereotype.name: ModeErrorBehavior
Stereotype.notes: This represents the ability to define the error behavior in the context of mode handling.

Tag.name: defaultMode
Tag.description: This represents the ModeDeclaration that is considered the error mode in the context of the enclosing Mode DeclarationGroup.

Tag.name: errorReactionPolicy
Tag.description: This represents the ability to define the policy in terms of which default model shall apply in case an error occurs.

Stereotype.name: ModeRequestTypeMap
Stereotype.notes: Specifies a mapping between a ModeDeclarationGroup and an ImplementationDataType ImplementationDataType shall be used to implement the ModeDeclarationGroup.

Tag.name: implementation DataType
Tag.description: This is the corresponding AbstractImplementationDataType. It shall be modeled along the idea of an "unsigned integer-like" data type.

Stereotype.name: ModeTransition
Stereotype.notes: This meta-class represents the ability to describe possible ModeTransitions in the context of a Mode DeclarationGroup.
